org.bulldog.core.gpio

Class Pin

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bulldog.core.gpio.Pin
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BeagleBonePin, RaspberryPiPin

    public class Pin
extends java.lang.Object

    A pin in libbulldog is solely a management container. It contains features that can be activated on it.

    E.g. one might choose to use the Pin as a DigitalOutput or a DigitalInput.

    The pin contains the necessary information to be set up according to the user's wishes. If the information of this class is not enough, then board implementations derive from it. It ensures that only one feature can be activated at a time. If asynchronous or blocking operations are currently in progress on another feature, then the pin will deny any other feature activation during that time.

    Mostly, the pin is just used to grab a feature that is available on it:
    DigitalOutput output = pin.as(DigitalOutput.class);
    Pwm pwm = pin.as(Pwm.class);

      • activateFeature

        public <T extends PinFeature> void activateFeature(java.lang.Class<T> feature)
        Activates a feature on a pin.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type (classname) of the desired feature
        Parameters:
        feature - the type (classname) of the desired feature

      • addFeature

        public Pin addFeature(PinFeature feature)
        Adds the feature to the pin. This method is used to provide a pin instance with all the features that it is capable of.
        Parameters:
        feature - the instance of the feature to be added
        Returns:
        the pin for a fluent style API

      • removeFeature

        public Pin removeFeature(java.lang.Class<? extends PinFeature> featureClass)
        Removes a feature from a pin. More precisely, it removes the first occurrence of a feature class from the pin.
        Parameters:
        featureClass - the feature class to be removed
        Returns:
        the pin for a fluent style API

      • as

        public <T extends PinFeature> T as(java.lang.Class<T> feature)
        This is a very important method. It is the standard way to configure a pin for usage with a desired feature (e.g. PWM, DigitalIO).
        Type Parameters:
        T - the concrete type of the pin feature.
        Parameters:
        feature - the classname of the feature.
        Returns:
        the the concrete type of the pin feature.

      • block

        public void block(PinFeature blocker)
        Blocks a pin. While a pin is blocked, not other pin feature can be activated on the pin until it unblocks the pin. See unblock.
        Parameters:
        blocker - the pin feature that should block the pin.

      • unblock

        public void unblock(PinFeature blocker)
        Unblocks a pin if it is currently blocked.
        Parameters:
        blocker - the feature that currently blocks the pin. If the pin is blocked, but not by the pin feature given in the argument, then a PinBlockedException will be thrown.

      • getBlocker

        public PinFeature getBlocker()
        Gets the pin feature that currently blocks the pin.
        Returns:
        the pin feature that currently blocks the pin.

      • isBlocked

        public boolean isBlocked()
        Checks if the pin is currently blocked by a feature.
        Returns:
        true, if is blocked

      • getFeature

        public <T extends PinFeature> T getFeature(java.lang.Class<T> featureClass)
        Grabs a feature from the pin, if it is available. First, the method will look for a pin feature class that exactly matches the class specified in the argument. If that cannot be found, it returns a pin feature that is at least assignable from the desired feature class.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the concrete type of the pin feature
        Parameters:
        featureClass - the class of the pin feature
        Returns:
        the feature if it was found or null otherwise.

        public PinFeature getActiveFeature()
        Gets the active feature.
        Returns:
        the feature that is currently active on this pin.

        Returns:
        true, if the feature class is active on the pin

        Gets a list of all registered FeatureActivationListeners.
        Returns:
        a list containing all registered FeatureActivationListeners

      • fireFeatureActivating

        protected void fireFeatureActivating(PinFeature feature)
        This method fires the feature activating event. It denotes that a feature activation has begun. the feature is not ready for use yet. All registered FeatureActivationListeners will react on it.
        Parameters:
        feature - the feature that is currently being activated

      • fireFeatureActivated

        protected void fireFeatureActivated(PinFeature feature)
        This method fires the feature activated event. It denotes that a feature has been fully activated and is ready for use. All registered FeatureActivationListeners will react on it.
        Parameters:
        feature - the feature that is currently being activated

      • fireFeatureDeactivating

        protected void fireFeatureDeactivating(PinFeature feature)
        This method fires the feature deactivating event. It denotes that a feature deactivation has begun. the feature is not torn down yet. All registered FeatureActivationListeners will react on it.
        Parameters:
        feature - the feature that is currently being activated

      • fireFeatureDeactivated

        protected void fireFeatureDeactivated(PinFeature feature)
        This method fires the feature deactivated event. It denotes that a feature deactivation has finished. the feature is completely torn down. All registered FeatureActivationListeners will react on it.
        Parameters:
        feature - the feature that is currently being activated
